capstone.data

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.data.Data
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Highscore, LevelBuilder, Profile, Theme

    public abstract class Data
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Base class for all data-managing objects. Defines a few methods for loading and storing files and properties.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a file for a properties file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for any I/O error opening the file.

      • deserialize

        public abstract void deserialize(java.util.Properties serialization)
        How to deserialize the data and load the fields of the class. Depends on the data and the class, of course.
        Parameters:
        serialization - The properties containing the data.

      • store

        public abstract void store()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        The default store operation. The subclasses determine what the default path is, e.g. "resources/profiles".
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for any I/O error.

      • store

        public void store(java.io.File directory)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Stores the properties retrieved via the abstract serialize() method at the directory, the filename coming from the abstract fileName() method, which subclasses must implement to determine how to store the file e.g. the name of the level and the date for a session.
        Parameters:
        directory - Where to store the data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for any I/O error.

      • serialize

        public abstract java.util.Properties serialize()
        Returns the data as a Properties file.
        Returns:
        The data of the class as a Properties file.

      • fileName

        public abstract java.lang.String fileName()
        A filename representation for the data, containing relevant information such as the name of a level or the id of a profile. Also should have a proper file extension such as .profile.
        Returns:
        The filename string.

      • get

        protected static java.lang.String get(java.util.Properties properties,
                                      java.lang.String key)
        Gets the property associated with the given key from a properties file. Method names of Properites are too long. Also gotta assert that the key is contained first.
        Parameters:
        properties - Where to get the data from.
        key - The key to get the value/property for.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key.

      • pop

        protected static java.lang.String pop(java.util.Properties properties,
                                      java.lang.String key)
        Gets and removes the property associated with the given key from a properties file. Method names of Properites are too long. Also gotta assert that the key is contained first.
        Parameters:
        properties - Where to get the data from.
        key - The key to get the value/property for.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key.

      • _load

        protected static java.util.Properties _load(java.io.File file)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Utility method to load a Properties object from a file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load.
        Returns:
        The contained properties, if any.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when batman becomes the next pope.

      • _getName

        protected static java.lang.String _getName(java.io.File file)
        Utility method to get the filename of a file, without extension.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to get the filename of.
        Returns:
        The filename of the file, without extension.
